oneHanded.name: One Handed
oneHanded.description: Mastery of fighting with one-handed weapons either with a shield or without.

twoHanded.name: Two Handed
twoHanded.description: Mastery of fighting with two-handed weapons of average length such as bigger axes and swords.

polearm.name: Polearm
polearm.description: Mastery of the spear, lance, staff and other polearms, both one-handed and two-handed.

bow.name: Bow
bow.description: Familarity with bows and physical conditioning to shoot with them effectively.

crossbow.name: Crossbow
crossbow.description: Knowledge of operating and maintaining crossbows.

throwing.name: Throwing
throwing.description: Mastery of throwing projectiles accurately and with power.

riding.name: Riding
riding.description: The ability to control a horse, to keep your balance when it moves suddenly or unexpectedly, as well as general knowledge of horses, including their care and breeding.

crafting.name: Smithing
crafting.description: The knowledge of how to forge metal, match handle to blade, turn poles, sew scales, and other skills useful in the assembly of weapons and armor

scouting.name: Scouting
scouting.description: Knowledge of how to scan the wilderness for life. You can follow tracks, spot movement in the undergrowth, and spot an enemy across the valley from a flash of light on spearpoints or a dustcloud.

tactics.name: Tactics
tactics.description: Your judgment of how troops will perform in contact. This allows you to make a good prediction of when an unorthodox tactic will work, and when it won't.

roguery.name: Roguery
roguery.description: Experience with the darker side of human life. You can tell when a guard wants a bribe, you know how to intimidate someone, and have a good sense of what you can and can't get away with.

charm.name: Charm
charm.description: The ability to make a person like and trust you. You can make a good guess at people's motivations and the kinds of arguments to which they'll respond.

leadership.name: Leadership
leadership.description: The ability to inspire. You can fill individuals with confidence and stir up enthusiasm and courage in larger groups.

trade.name: Trade
trade.description: Familiarity with the most common goods in the marketplace and their prices, as well as the ability to spot defective goods or tell if you've been shortchanged in quantity

steward.name: Steward
steward.description: Ability to organize a group and manage logistics. This helps you to run an estate or administer a town, and can increase the size of a party that you lead or in which you serve as quartermaster.

medicine.name: Medicine
medicine.description: Knowledge of how to staunch bleeding, to set broken bones, to remove embedded weapons and clean wounds to prevent infection, and to apply poultices to relieve pain and soothe inflammation.

engineering.name: Engineering
engineering.description: Knowledge of how to make things that can withstand powerful forces without collapsing. Useful for building both structures and the devices that knock them down.
